title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 349-2.10 - Payment of fees and award

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 349-2.10 - Payment of fees and award

State Regulations

The parties to disputed therapy bill proceedings shall
each pay to the chairman a sum equal to five per centum of the amount payable
under such decision or $5, whichever is greater. If there is no amount payable
under such decision, or if the disputed bill is determined by notice of
settlement (A-4), each party to the proceeding shall pay to the chairman a
minimum arbitration fee of $5. The sum so collected shall be transferred to the

State treasury to reimburse it on account of the expense of administration. Payment pursuant to the decision of the arbitration committee shall be made as
follows: (a) If the amount of the bill
awarded under a decision other than a notice of settlement (A-4) is more than
$100, the carrier shall promptly: (1)
pay to
the therapist the amount directed in the award and decision, less the balance
of the arbitration fee of five per centum due from the therapist; (2)
pay to the chairman an arbitration fee
due from the carrier of five per centum of the amount directed in the award and
decision, plus the balance of the arbitration fee due from the therapist and
deducted pursuant to paragraph (1) of this subdivision. (b) If the amount of the bill awarded under a
decision is $100 or less, or the amount is determined pursuant to a notice of
settlement (A-4), the carrier shall: (1)
pay
to the therapist the amount directed in the award and decision, or determined
as set forth in the notice of settlement; (2)
pay to the chairman the minimum
arbitration fee due from the carrier of $5. (c) Pay to the chairman the carrier minimum
arbitration fee of $5 if the bill is disallowed. Notes
